context.p: cluster modeconfiguration for HDFSCluster mode pipelines that read from HDFS require the Cloudera distribution of Hadoop (CDH) or Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP).
Complete the following steps to configure a cluster mode pipeline to read from HDFS:

step.cmd: Verify the installation of HDFS and YARN.
Install on a YARN gateway node.
To enable to submit YARN jobs, perform one of the following tasks:

ul.li:
After you create the pipeline, specify a Hadoop FS user in the Hadoop FS origin.
For the Hadoop FS User property, enter a user with an ID that is higher than the min.user.id property, or with a user name that is listed in the allowed.system.users property.

step.cmd: On YARN, verify that the Hadoop logging level is set to a severity of INFO or lower.
step.info:
YARN sets the Hadoop logging level to INFO by default. To change the logging level:
Edit the log4j.properties file.
By default, the file is located in the following directory: /etc/hadoop/conf
Set the log4j.rootLogger property to a severity of INFO or lower, such as DEBUG or TRACE.

step.cmd: In the pipeline properties, on the General tab, set the Execution Mode property to Cluster Batch.
On the Cluster tab, enter the required properties to read from HDFS.
In the pipeline, use the Hadoop FS origin for cluster mode.
step.info: On the General tab of the origin, select the appropriate CDH or HDP stage library for cluster mode.

step.cmd: If YARN is configured to use Kerberos authentication, in the origin, enable the Kerberos Authentication property on the Hadoop FS tab.
